Key Match Events: Endrick was unable to find a breakthrough for Brazil in their draw against Costa Rica.
Brazil had an early opportunity when Raphinha latched on to a long ball, but Costa Rica's Patrick Sequeira saved the danger.
Brazil thought they had scored in the 30th minute but the goal was disallowed for offside after a VAR review.
Lucas Paquetá rattled the woodwork with a long-range effort in the 63rd minute.
Guilherme Arana's strike was saved by a fine save from Costa Rica's Sequeira.
Vinícius Junior was brought on in the 70th minute but couldn't find a way through Costa Rica's defense.
Paquetá shot wide in the final 10 minutes as Brazil failed to break the deadlock.
Costa Rica's defense was resolute, containing Brazil and depriving them of space.
Pre-Game Insights: Brazil came into the tournament on the back of a run of poor results in recent months.
Costa Rica looked to contain Brazil and deprive them of space with a five-man defense.
Brazil tried to shift Vinícius inside but couldn't find a way through.
Coach Dorival Júnior brought on younger players Endrick and Sávio in the 70th minute.
Post-Match Reflections: Vinícius Junior said, 'We know we can improve, we have to improve.'
Vinícius said, 'Every time I enter the field for the national team, I have three or four players marking me.'
Dorival Júnior said, 'We tried with [Vinícius] on the wing and we didn’t succeed. Then we put him inside and we couldn’t find a way through either.'

Brazil's fans want everything immediately done, but we're going little by little. In the next game, I’m sure we’ll play much better because we now already understand what the competition will be like, what the pitch, what the referees will be like.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Neymar, Brazil's all-time leading scorer, was sidelined by an anterior cruciate ligament injury and watched from the stands.
James Rodríguez scored both goals for Colombia against Paraguay, evoking memories of his breakthrough performance at the 2014 World Cup.
Rodríguez was named man of the match after setting up both goals in Colombia's 2-1 win over Paraguay.
